column3: Yes. Adding a hint makes sense.\nThough I'm not sure if we should add it below the RPC/curl info. What speaks against mentioning `getmempoolentry` in the description?
agreed @jonasschnelli I think just putting that in the main body of help is best. \n\nI might stop reading by the examples...
I agree with the others. The hint should be further up, between the main text and the arguments listing.\n\nOtherwise utACK

Moved hint to below description. Should it be a part of it (i.e. no space)? Below is current output:
```
$ ./bitcoin-cli -regtest help getrawmempool
getrawmempool ( verbose )

Returns all transaction ids in memory pool as a json array of string transaction ids.

Hint: use getmempoolentry to fetch a specific transaction from the mempool.

Arguments:
1. verbose (boolean, optional
